content.description: Fire the first few bolts of 5.10 climbing to an easier finish. One of the original warm up routes for the haunted wall.
Enjoy the varied terrain on this area warm-up. Good holds lead you up to a bulge crux.
content.location: On the buttress right before the haunted wall.

content.description: Maybe one of the best 5.10s in the state, certainly of this particular style. Climb a few bolts of sometimes wet (but easy) slab before moving left onto the main wall. Once you get established on the main wall, gun it because it is unrelenting! Enjoy the spacing of the bolts on this one, and don't be afraid to take the ride.
content.location: Begins on the black slab on the right side of the wall.

content.description: Easy jug roof climbing takes you to the headwall where a very tricky boulder problem awaits. Some will dyno, some will not, you decide how you want to get blasted.
content.location: Begins on the slab underneath the largest part of the roof. Climbs into the headwall after clipping the very long chain draw.

content.description: Need to add some adventure to your day of sport climbing? Share the start with Disaster Blaster up the moderate white slab but traverse right under the roof crack, crossing Meet the Creeper at the lip. Continue up the crack as it widens to a crux near the top.
content.protection: SR, doubles of #3s and #4s, optional #5. Slings to extend roof placements, topout to a tree anchor. (Rack on left helps at the top.)
content.location: Shared start with Disaster Blaster and tops out between Meet the Creeper and Broken Promises.

content.description: This sickboy start to Chunks of Flesh takes you straight up on small edges into the last half of Chunks. May be easier the taller you are.
content.location: Direct start to Chunks of Flesh.
Furthest left climb on the Haunted Wall.

climbs.name: Casper's Corner
climbs.fa: Uli Garcia & Jon Van Volkenburgh, Dec 2020

content.description: Casper is a friendly ghost just like this friendly route! Start in the corner and climb past a few ledges with chickenheads in between. Protect the final mini-roof from below then pull the lip with either perfect hands or more chickenheads. Build a tree anchor or traverse left to use the anchors on Ghoul-Aid. A great beginner trad route.
content.protection: SR to #3, doubles of #1s and #2s. Slings for tree anchor or directionals at the top.
content.location: Right of Ghoul-Aid on the left side of the corner crack separating it from Black and Gold Wall.

content.description: A slabby and chicken-heady warm-up. First ascent rights were potentially violated on this one, but best to leave that to the developer and his wife...
content.location: First route right of the haunted wall.

content.description: This route climbs much longer than it looks and takes you through a couple of distinct and memorable sections. One of the best climbs at Haunt, and perhaps one of the best 5.12s around.
content.protection: 7 bolts, one of which has a fixed chain. Fixed anchors.
content.location: Starts in the middle of the wall and trends up and right.

content.description: Climb the first few bolts of Boogeyman and break right after the move off of the big horn jug. This route might change a bit if a bolt moves, but for now traverse some jugs into the crux of Disaster Blaster and finish straight up. It'll look like rope drag will be horrible, but it's not bad at all with some longer draws in the middle of the route. It's a P.I.T.A. to clean, and back-roping it recommended to get those lower draws back.
content.location: First few bolts of Boogeyman into the end of Disaster Blaster.

content.description: Who's ready for a linkup? This one's quality and may beat Chunks for best 11 on the wall. Start on Disaster Blaster, clipping one bolt above the fixed chains. But before you Blast the crux traverse right on jugs and join Meet the Creeper at its 5th bolt (an extended draw here helps reduce drag). Enjoy milder climbing to the anchors. Don't get too Creeped out on the traverse, the fall's safe!
content.protection: 5 bolts, 2 of which have fixed chains. Fixed anchor.
content.location: Start in the dirty corner and jug traverse as for Disaster Blaster, end at the anchor of Meet the Creeper.

content.description:
The crown jewel of Haunt Hollow. This 60 foot, overhanging and continuous shield of rock will make you ask yourself, "Why am I so pumped on jugs?". With multiple 5-star climbs, this wall is not to be missed.

 The Haunted Wall faces south/southeast so it gets a decent amount of sun.
